abstract.t: This document describes a lightweight binary protocol over TCP for performing simple mathematical operations such as multiplication, average, and vector subtraction. It is designed for simplicity, minimal overhead, and use in educational or constrained environments.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: This protocol allows a client to connect to a server over TCP and request one of three operations. Each message consists of a binary-encoded header and body. The server replies with a binary-encoded response depending on the operation result or error.

The remainder of this document SHOULD be organized as follows. explains the terminology used in this document. provides a high-level overview of the protocol. provides the details of the clients' protocol header. provides the details of the servers' response header.

section.title: Requirements Language
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC2119.

section.title: Terminology
section.t:
This document uses the following terms:
Protocol - A pre-approved communication language between two end systems. Server - The part of the communication protocol that receives the request. In this project the server is an analytical engine which performs 3 operations. Client - The part of the communication protocol that starts the request. In this project the client is anyone who gives the server numbers to perform the operations. byte - An 8-bit octet

section.t: provides a detailed high-level overview of the message exchange between the server and the client.

section.title: Port
section.t: This Protocol uses the Port 12345.

section.title: Protocol Header Format Client
section.t: The following headers are required in order to satisfy all the requirements
Each header SHOULD be in a different subsection

section.title: Start of header
section.t: This is the start of the first message sent by the Client to initiate the communication process...(This is not the complete header!)
The following figure shows the message format.
Headers SHOULD be defined in ascii and each field explained in detail as follows:

list.t: Operation Code: (uses B format character) Multiplication of signed 16-bit integers. Average of unsigned 16-bit integers. Vector subtraction of unsigned 16-bit integers.
Count (N): The number of values to operate on. The server validates whether N is within acceptable bounds. (uses B format character)

section.title: Header with Operation Code: 1
section.t: This is the full message sent by the Client to initiate the communication process for multiplication...
The following figure shows the full message format.
N SHOULD be between 2 and 10.
The numbers SHOULD be between -5 and 5.

section.title: Header with Operation Code: 2
section.t: This is the full message sent by the Client to initiate the communication process for finding the average...
The following figure shows the full message format.
N SHOULD be between 2 and 20.
The numbers SHOULD be between 0 and 200.

section.title: Header with Operation Code: 3
section.t: This is the full message sent by the Client to initiate the communication process for subtraction...
The following figure shows the full message format.
N SHOULD be between 2 and 10.
The numbers SHOULD be between 0 and 60000.

section.title: Server Response Header
section.t: These are the response headers for every operation

section.title: Response Header for Operations Codes: 1,2
section.t: The following figure shows the full message format.

list.t: Exit Code: 0, everything worked properly, uses B format character
1: result is returned, uses B format character
The result uses f format character

section.title: Response Header for Operations Code: 3
section.t: The following figure shows the full message format.

list.t: Exit Code: 0, everything worked properly, uses B format character
n results are returned, uses B format character

section.title: Response Header for Errors
section.t: The following figure shows the full message format.

list.t: Exit Code: (uses B format character) Wrong count of numbers (N is wrong). A number is bigger than the allowed limit. A number is smaller than the allowed limit. Connection closed prematurely, EOFError. Unknown Error.
0: No result is returned (uses B format character)
0.0: float number to reach 8 bytes, the client recieves 8 bytes.

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: There is no security in this specification. This is a prototype and all messages should be sent in cleartext over the wire.
This is a VERY unsecure protocol. Please do not implement.
